Cause Child <13 to View/Listen Sex. Act.

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Atty Julius Andriusis appearing for Def.  Atty Peter John Cannon for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Case called at 4:15 p.m.  Interpreter appearing in person:  Vicki Bermudez.  Counsel has not been able to contact the defendant after bailing out and family members also do not know of his location.

Hearing at 10-21-2015 02:45 pm

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Julius Andriusis.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State.  Clerk: EZ.   Interpreter appearing in person:  Vicki Bermudez.  Counsel argues for lower cash bond of $5,000-7,000.00, State objects to bail modification.  Court denies bail modification.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Julius Andriusis.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Interpreter appearing in person:  Vicki Bermudez.  Atty. deJunco moves to withdraw due to substitute counsel, Court permits withdrawal of counsel and Atty. Andriusis is substituted.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State files an Information.  Defendant waives reading of the Information.  Not guilty plea entered to all counts.  Hearing scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

Hearing at 09-21-2015 09:45 am

Def appears in custody & by Atty Alyssa Armbrust for State Public Defenders Office.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State.   Interpreter appearing by phone: Sally Nichols;   Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  State requests cash bond; Argument from defense;  Court sets $10,000 cash bond; SPD will represent defendant;  Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights.   Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney and for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 09:45 am.
